trial_identification.studytitle: Transcranial Electrical Stimulation (TES) for the Treatment of Depression.

interventions.interventions:
Treatment: devices - Sham TES Treatment: devices - Active TES
Active Comparator: Active TES - Active TES
Sham Comparator: Sham TES - Sham TES
Treatment: devices: Sham TES Neuroconn Eldith device
Treatment: devices: Active TES Neuroconn Eldith device

primaryOutcome.outcome: Montgomery Asberg Depression Rating Scale for Depression (MADRS)

eligibility.inclusivecriteria:
- DSM-IV Major Depressive Episode (as part of a Major Depressive Disorder or Bipolar Disorder), of minimum 4 weeks duration.
- MADRS score = 20 at study entry.

recruitment.hospital: Black Dog Institute / University of New South Wales - Sydney

sponsorship.primarysponsorname: The University of New South Wales

ethicsAndSummary.summary: This study is a RCT of transcranial electrical stimulation in depressed patients. Mood, cognitive test performance and biomarkers will be measured during the trial.
